fact_text: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman is known as the Father of the Nation of Bangladesh.
Bangladesh achieved independence on 26 March 1971 after a nine-month Liberation War against Pakistan.
The Lahore Resolution of 1940 demanded separate Muslim-majority states in eastern and northwestern India.
বাংলাদেশের মুক্তিযুদ্ধ ১৯৭১ সালের ২৫ মার্চ রাতে শুরু হয়, যখন পাকিস্তান সেনাবাহিনী অপারেশন সার্চলাইট চালায়।
The Awami League was founded in 1949 in Dhaka by Maulana Abdul Hamid Khan Bhashani.
The Language Movement of 1952 demanded recognition of Bengali as a state language of Pakistan.
The Six-Point Movement of 1966 was launched by Sheikh Mujibur Rahman demanding autonomy for East Pakistan.
Sheikh Mujibur Rahman delivered his historic 7th March 1971 speech at the Ramna Race Course in Dhaka.
Pakistan surrendered to the joint forces of India and Bangladesh on 16 December 1971 at Ramna Race Course.
Tajuddin Ahmad was the first Prime Minister of Bangladesh during the provisional government in 1971.
The Agartala Conspiracy Case of 1968 was filed against Sheikh Mujibur Rahman and 34 others by the Pakistani government.
বাংলাদেশ ১৯৭২ সালের ১০ জানুয়ারি বঙ্গবন্ধু শেখ মুজিবুর রহমানের স্বদেশ প্রত্যাবর্তন দিবস হিসেবে পালিত হয়।
The capital of Bangladesh is Dhaka, located on the banks of the Buriganga River.
Bangladesh is divided into 8 administrative divisions: Barishal, Chattogram, Dhaka, Khulna, Mymensingh, Rajshahi, Rangpur, and Sylhet.
The Padma River is the main distributary of the Ganges and the largest river in Bangladesh by discharge volume.
The Sundarbans is the largest single block of tidal halophytic mangrove forest in the world, covering approximately 10,000 square kilometers.
The highest peak in Bangladesh is Saka Haphong (previously Keokradong was considered highest), with an elevation of approximately 1,052 meters.
The Bay of Bengal is the largest bay in the world, bordering Bangladesh to the south.
Cox's Bazar has the longest unbroken natural sandy sea beach in the world, stretching approximately 120 kilometers.
বাংলাদেশের মোট আয়তন ১,৪৭,৫৭০ বর্গ কিলোমিটার।
The Chittagong Hill Tracts comprise three districts: Rangamati, Khagrachhari, and Bandarban.
Saint Martin's Island is the only coral island in Bangladesh, located in the northeastern Bay of Bengal.
The Meghna, Padma, and Jamuna are the three major river systems in Bangladesh.
Sylhet is known for its tea gardens; Bangladesh is the 10th largest tea producer in the world.
Sheikh Hasina served as the Prime Minister of Bangladesh from 2009 to 2024.
Muhammad Yunus was appointed as the Chief Adviser of Bangladesh's interim government in August 2024.
Justice Syed Refaat Ahmed was appointed as the 24th Chief Justice of Bangladesh in 2024.
General Waker-Uz-Zaman was appointed as the Chief of Army Staff of Bangladesh in June 2024.
Abdus Salam served as Bangladesh's first Foreign Secretary from 1971 to 1972.
Syed Nazrul Islam served as the Acting President of Bangladesh during the Liberation War in 1971.
বাংলাদেশের প্রথম রাষ্ট্রপতি ছিলেন বঙ্গবন্ধু শেখ মুজিবুর রহমান।
Muhammad Shahabuddin was elected as the 22nd President of Bangladesh in February 2023.
Bangladesh is the world's second-largest garment exporter after China, with RMG exports exceeding $40 billion in 2023.
The official currency of Bangladesh is the Bangladeshi Taka (BDT), managed by Bangladesh Bank.
Bangladesh is the world's largest producer of jute, supplying over 33% of global jute output.
Bangladesh's GDP was approximately $460 billion (PPP) in 2023, making it the 25th largest economy.
Remittances from Bangladeshi diaspora workers exceeded $21 billion in 2023.
বাংলাদেশের প্রধান রপ্তানি পণ্য হলো তৈরি পোশাক, যা মোট রপ্তানি আয়ের ৮৪% এরও বেশি।
The Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) is the main stock exchange of Bangladesh, established in 1954.
Bangladesh achieved lower-middle income country status in 2015 according to World Bank classification.
Grameen Bank, founded by Muhammad Yunus in 1983, pioneered the concept of microcredit.
The Payra Deep Sea Port in Patuakhali is Bangladesh's third seaport, inaugurated in 2013.
The Constitution of Bangladesh was adopted on 4 November 1972 and came into effect on 16 December 1972.
The Bangladesh Constitution originally had four fundamental principles: nationalism, socialism, democracy, and secularism.
The Jatiya Sangsad (National Parliament) of Bangladesh is a unicameral legislature with 350 seats.
বাংলাদেশের সংবিধানের ধারা ১৫২ অনুযায়ী, রাষ্ট্রভাষা বাংলা।
The Supreme Court of Bangladesh consists of two divisions: the Appellate Division and the High Court Division.
The 15th Amendment to the Constitution of Bangladesh abolished the caretaker government system in 2011.
Article 44 of the Bangladesh Constitution guarantees the right of citizens to enforce fundamental rights through the High Court Division.
The Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) of Bangladesh was established in 2004 under the ACC Act.
The national anthem of Bangladesh, 'Amar Sonar Bangla', was written by Rabindranath Tagore.
Pohela Boishakh (Bengali New Year) is celebrated on 14 April each year as the largest secular festival in Bangladesh.
The Shaheed Minar in Dhaka was built to commemorate the martyrs of the 1952 Language Movement.
বাংলাদেশের জাতীয় ফুল শাপলা (নিম্ফিয়া নুচালি)।
The National Museum of Bangladesh, located in Shahbag, Dhaka, was established in 1913 and is one of the largest museums in South Asia.
Mangal Shobhajatra, the Pohela Boishakh procession organized by Dhaka University, was inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list in 2016.
Kazi Nazrul Islam, the national poet of Bangladesh, was born on 24 May 1899 in Churulia, West Bengal.
The Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman Memorial Museum in Dhaka commemorates the life of Bangladesh's founding father.
The University of Dhaka, established in 1921, is the oldest and largest university in Bangladesh.
Bangladesh has a literacy rate of approximately 74.66% as of the 2022 census.
The Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) was established in 1962 in Dhaka.
বাংলাদেশ সরকারি কর্ম কমিশন (পিএসসি) বিসিএস পরীক্ষা পরিচালনা করে প্রজাতন্ত্রের কর্মকর্তা নিয়োগের জন্য।
The National University of Bangladesh, established in 1992, affiliates over 2,200 colleges across the country.
Rajshahi University was established in 1953 and is the second oldest university in Bangladesh.
The primary education completion rate in Bangladesh reached 98% by 2023.
The Bangladesh Madrasah Education Board oversees over 9,000 madrasahs across the country.
Bangladesh became a member of the United Nations on 17 September 1974.
Bangladesh is one of the largest contributors to UN peacekeeping operations, with over 6,500 personnel deployed globally.
India was the first country to recognize Bangladesh as an independent nation on 6 December 1971.
Bangladesh is a founding member of SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation), established in 1985.
বাংলাদেশ ওআইসি (ইসলামী সহযোগিতা সংস্থা)-এর সদস্য, যা ৫৭টি মুসলিম-সংখ্যাগরিষ্ঠ দেশের সংগঠন।
The Ganges Water Treaty between Bangladesh and India was signed in 1996 for sharing Ganges waters at Farakka.
Bangladesh joined the World Trade Organization (WTO) on 1 January 1995 as a founding member.
The Chittagong Hill Tracts Peace Accord was signed on 2 December 1997 between the government and the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti.
Bangabandhu-1, Bangladesh's first geostationary communications satellite, was launched on 12 May 2018 by SpaceX.
Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission operates the TRIGA Mark-II research reactor at Savar since 1986.
The Rooppur Nuclear Power Plant in Pabna is Bangladesh's first nuclear power plant, expected to generate 2,400 MW.
বাংলাদেশে ইন্টারনেট ব্যবহারকারীর সংখ্যা ২০২৩ সালে ১৩ কোটি ছাড়িয়ে গেছে।
Bangladesh's submarine cable connection to the SEA-ME-WE 4 network provides international internet bandwidth since 2006.
Dr. Maksudul Alam led the team that sequenced the genome of jute in 2010, a first for Bangladesh.
Bangladesh became a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) in 2000.
Shakib Al Hasan is the highest wicket-taker for Bangladesh in international cricket with over 700 wickets across formats.
Bangladesh won the ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup for the first time in 2020 in South Africa.
Kabaddi is the national sport of Bangladesh.
বাংলাদেশের জাতীয় ক্রিকেট দলের প্রথম টেস্ট ম্যাচ ছিল ভারতের বিরুদ্ধে ২০০০ সালের নভেম্বরে।
Grameenphone Dhaka Premier League and the Bangladesh Premier League are the top domestic cricket tournaments.
The Padma Multipurpose Bridge, inaugurated in June 2022, is 6.15 km long, the longest bridge in Bangladesh.
The Dhaka Metro Rail (MRT Line-6), Bangladesh's first metro system, began commercial operations on 28 December 2022.
Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka is the busiest airport in Bangladesh, handling over 8 million passengers annually.
বাংলাদেশ রেলওয়ে ২,৯৫৬ কিলোমিটার রেলপথ পরিচালনা করে, যার মধ্যে ব্রড গেজ ও মিটার গেজ উভয়ই রয়েছে।
The Karnaphuli Tunnel under the Karnaphuli River in Chattogram is the first underwater tunnel in South Asia, completed in 2023.
Mongla Port, located in Bagerhat district, is the second largest seaport of Bangladesh.
Bangladesh is the 8th most populous country in the world, with a population exceeding 170 million as of 2023.
Bangladesh has a population density of approximately 1,265 people per square kilometer, one of the highest in the world.
Approximately 98% of Bangladesh's population speaks Bengali as their mother tongue.
Bangladesh is home to the largest refugee settlement in the world at Kutupalong, housing over 1 million Rohingya refugees from Myanmar.
বাংলাদেশের গড় আয়ু ২০২৩ সালে ৭২.৩ বছর।
The Royal Bengal Tiger is the national animal of Bangladesh, primarily found in the Sundarbans.
The national bird of Bangladesh is the Oriental Magpie-Robin, known locally as 'Doel'.
The water lily (Nymphaea nouchali), known as 'Shapla', is the national flower of Bangladesh.
The Ilish (Hilsa) is the national fish of Bangladesh and contributes about 12% of total fish production.
বাংলাদেশের জাতীয় বৃক্ষ আম গাছ (Mangifera indica)।
The official language of Bangladesh is Bengali (Bangla), spoken by over 98% of the population.
International Mother Language Day on 21 February was declared by UNESCO in 1999 to honor the 1952 Language Movement in Bangladesh.
Bengali is the 7th most spoken language in the world, with approximately 230 million native speakers.
বাংলা একাডেমি ১৯৫৫ সালে প্রতিষ্ঠিত হয় বাংলা ভাষা ও সাহিত্যের গবেষণা ও প্রচারের জন্য।
The Bangladesh Armed Forces consist of three branches: the Bangladesh Army, the Bangladesh Navy, and the Bangladesh Air Force.
Bangladesh Armed Forces Day is observed on 21 November, commemorating the 1971 Liberation War.
BNS Bangabandhu is the flagship of the Bangladesh Navy, a guided missile frigate commissioned in 2001.
The Bangladesh Military Academy is located in Bhatiari, Chattogram.
Bangladesh has a tropical monsoon climate, with an average annual rainfall of 2,300 mm.
Sylhet receives the highest rainfall in Bangladesh, averaging over 4,000 mm annually.
Bangladesh is one of the most climate-vulnerable countries, with about 17% of its land area expected to be inundated by a 1-meter sea level rise.
Bangladesh is scheduled to graduate from Least Developed Country (LDC) status by 2026.
The student-led mass uprising in July-August 2024 led to the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government.
Bangladesh experienced severe floods in 2024, displacing over 5 million people across multiple districts.
বাংলাদেশ ২০২৪ সালে জাতিসংঘ মানবাধিকার পরিষদের সদস্য নির্বাচিত হয়।
Sheikh Mujibur Rahman is the Father of the Nation of Bangladesh.
Dhaka is the capital city of Bangladesh.
Bangladesh gained independence in 1971 after a war of liberation against Pakistan.
The Padma Bridge is the longest bridge in Bangladesh, spanning 6.15 kilometers.
Cox's Bazar beach is the longest natural sea beach in the world at approximately 120 km.
Bangladesh is a country.
